data.message:
Well, we Shannon Wood Rothenberg a gal! For a different kind of arc! Sign up!
http://denverimprovfestival.com/?page_id=13
Yer funny, Natalie!

Tired of montages? Ready to try improvising an entire story? Come play with instructor Shannon Wood Rothenberg, director of Makeshift Shakespeare, THIS Sunday 6/30!
https://www.eventbrite.com/event/6880574985
Happy Tuesday!!

data.message:
Come play with us this weekend at our Sunday Series with Shannon Wood Rothenberg! 

http://www.eventbrite.com/event/6880574985
So let's all just do some improv and make it awesome!

Tomorrow is our fourth Sunday Series workshop featuring Third Curd! They'll focus on partnering, supporting and making awesome faces (see below).
Come play!
http://www.eventbrite.com/event/6882139665
I'm so there!

Big thanks to Kerstin Caldwell of The YES! Lab for a great workshop this morning! Great stuff from Kerstin and great work from everyone who attended.

Registration is open for next week's workshop, Find Your Partner's Funny with Chris Woolf and Mark Shonsey of Third Curd!

http://www.eventbrite.com/event/6882139665

Their new form, the “Memento”, was an officia...

data.message: We are updating our website!! And we may experience some down time, so please check back!

Want to take a Sunday Series workshop but lack the twenty American dollars? Don't worry, we've got one of you guys covered! (Well, an anonymous donor has you covered...)

Enter in the comments section to win a FREE place in this week's workshop, Slow Down and Cut the Crap with Kerstin Caldwell, owner of The YES! Lab.

THIS WEEK'S CONTEST! Name your favorite random guest appearance by an improviser in a tv show or film. The DIF will randomly choose a winner from all the comments. Just text is welcome but video links are encouraged!

Here is our favorite to get you started:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DleceyAO34M
(Yes, that is Nick Armstrong, founder of ImprovUtopia taking Ron Swanson's order of "all the bacon and eggs you have.")
data.name: Parks and Recreation - Ron Swanson - Eggs & Bacon

data.message:
A great man once said "Life moves pretty fast. If you don't slow down and look around, you might miss it.

A great improv teacher also said "Slow down and cut the crap."

Come explore the concept of slowing down and cutting the crap in Kerstin Caldwell's workshop, "Slow Down & Cut the Crap" THIS Sunday, 16.June as part of the DIF Funraiser: Sunday Series.

http://www.eventbrite.com/event/6880619117

Let's try that link one more time!
http://www.eventbrite.com/event/6880619117

data.description: In this workshop of the DIF Fundraiser Sunday Series, improvisers will focus on absorbing and reacting to the environmental, sub-textual and emotional energies in the scene. We will explore how the unspoken elements of the scene often create the most honest, funny, rich moments. Adrian Holguin is a…

data.message:
Are you dying to take Eric Farone's Sunday Series Workshop this weekend, but you suffer from BIDs (Broke Improviser Disease)? 

Don't worry! We had a mysterious benefactor donate funds to cover a scholarship for us to give away for THIS Sunday's (6/9) class. 

What do you need to do to win this free class? Just write your BEST haiku about improv in the comments below. The best Haiku gets the class fo' free!

(I can't tell you who this mysterious benefactor was, but I can tell you that he is a millionaire playboy who likes to moonlight as a bat so... draw your own conclusions)

Check your object work
Your Finger is not a gun
Just hold the damn thing

A doctor's office
Please lord, don't let them suggest
A doctor's office.

They live within us
characters come not from wigs
masks are o.k. tho

Super fun first Sunday Series with Adrian Holguin! Check out next weeks class with Bovine Metropolis founder and long form rockstar, Eric Farone!
http://www.eventbrite.com/event/6880542889#
data.name: Sunday Series - June 9 - Quick Starts with Eric Farone
data.caption: www.eventbrite.com
data.description: Great scenes need to start the moment that the lights go up. Let's face it, in today's improv you've got less than 20 seconds to get a scene rolling. Even if you love to 'slow play', you still need to start strong. Strong beginnings make for fun, easier to play scenes. This sampler version of Eric F...

A big thank you to the Deer Pile and City, O' City for generously donating the Deer Pile space for our upcoming Sunday Series Fundraiser! Go see their shows and eat their delicious food.
What is the Sunday Series, you ask? Check it out here (http://denverimprovfestival.com/sunday-series/) and get yourself registered for some $20 workshops!

data.message: Quick update: we are having a few website issues, so please check back 󾌹 also, it may help to clear your cache. Thanks for all your support and patience. You can still sign up! http://www.eventbrite.com/event/4372532362
